tasks.task: Students learn about different methods of weed control in agriculture.
subtasks: Listen to an explanation from Darshana Mori on weed control principles.
Understand the principle of prevention in weed control.
Learn the principle of eradication in weed control.
Grasp the concept of control and management in weed control methods.

tasks.task: Discuss the mechanical method of weed control.
subtasks: Recognize that mechanical methods are also known as physical methods.
Identify various mechanical methods including tillage, hoeing, hand weeding, digging, and others.
Understand how tillage removes weeds and weakens perennial growth.
Explain how hoeing is used for perennial weeds and is cost-effective.
Learn about hand weeding with tools like khurpi or sickles.
Appreciate the benefit of digging for perennial weeds with deep roots.
Understand the process of sickling and moving to prevent seed production.
Know the role of burning in disposing of vegetation after sugar cane harvesting.
Recognize the use of flooding for water-sensitive weeds.

tasks.task: Evaluate the merits and demerits of mechanical weed control.
subtasks: Identify mechanical methods as the oldest and most effective.
Note the possibility of covering large areas quickly.
Understand the environmental safety of mechanical methods.
Acknowledge the need for proper conditions for mechanical weed control.
Recognize the labor-intensive nature and potential for crop damage.
